intro: Eminia benguellensis var. huillensis, commonly known as the Huillén eminia, is a rare and endemic plant species found in specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils and along riverbanks. Its botanical features make it an important subject for ecological and conservation studies. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered vulnerable and requires careful protection.
